name: form
title: Form
description: Form is a component for creating forms with validation on submit using vee-validate. You need to install vee-validate while using this component.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: A basic form with submit button and a simple input field.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputText } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :buttons-template="['submit']"
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Name"
        field-name="name"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Name is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Custom Buttons
sections.description: Customize button labels and template to include only specific actions like Save and Submit.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputText } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload)
}

const onSave = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form saved:', payload)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :buttons-template="['save', 'submit']"
    :save-btn-label="'Save Draft'"
    :submit-btn-label="'Complete'"
    @submit="onSubmit"
    @save="onSave"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Email"
        field-name="email"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Email is required', invalidFormat: 'Invalid email' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Hide Footer
sections.description: Hide the form footer to manage buttons externally.

sections.label: Column Layout
sections.description: Arrange form fields in multiple columns per row.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputText } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :column-per-row="2"
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="First Name"
        field-name="firstName"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'First name is required' }"
      />
      <InputText
        label="Last Name"
        field-name="lastName"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Last name is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Validation on Save
sections.description: When buttonsTemplate includes 'save', set validateOnSave to true to perform form validation on save button click, just like submit.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputText } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSave = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form saved:', payload)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :buttons-template="['save']"
    :validate-on-save="true"
    @save="onSave"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Username"
        field-name="username"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Username is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Stay After Submit
sections.description: Include a checkbox to keep the form visible after submission without resetting. The form visibility is handled manually after submit by checking property `stayAfterSubmit`. To hide the checkbox, set hideStayCheckbox to `false` to the Form component.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputText } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted, stay after submit:', payload.stayAfterSubmit)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form @submit="onSubmit">
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Feedback"
        field-name="feedback"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Feedback is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Set Values
sections.description: Use setValues to populate the form with existing data, typically for edit forms.

sections.label: Set Errors
sections.description: Manually set errors using setErrors, for example after receiving API response errors.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputEmail } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { useTemplateRef } from 'vue'

const form = useTemplateRef<Form>('form')
const apiErrors = {
  email: 'This email is already registered'
}

const simulateApiError = async () => {
  // Simulate an API call delay
  await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500))

  // Set errors returned from the "API"
  form.value?.setErrors(apiErrors)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    ref="form"
    :buttons-template="['submit']"
    :reset-after-submit="false"
    @submit="simulateApiError"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputEmail
        label="Email"
        field-name="email"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Email is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Conditional Fields
sections.description: Use the formValues from the fields slot to conditionally render input fields based on other field values.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, Dropdown, InputPassword } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form @submit="onSubmit">
    <template #fields="{ formValues }">
      <Dropdown
        label="User Type"
        field-name="userType"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'User type is required' }"
        :options="[
          { label: 'User', value: 'user' },
          { label: 'Admin', value: 'admin' }
        ]"
        option-label="label"
        option-value="value"
      />
      <InputPassword
        v-if="formValues.userType === 'admin'"
        label="Admin Password"
        field-name="adminPassword"
        placeholder="Enter admin password"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Admin password is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

name: button
title: Button
description: Button is an extension to standard button element with icons and theming.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Text to display on a button is defined with the `label` property.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Button } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
</script>

<template>
  <Button label="Submit" />
</template>

sections.label: Severity
sections.description: The severity property defines the variant of a button.

sections.label: Sizes
sections.description: Button provides small and large `sizes` as alternatives to the base.

sections.label: Icons
sections.description: Icon of a button is specified with `icon` property and position is configured using `iconPos` attribute. The `icon` property accepts any value from the [WangsIcons](/components/icon) collection.

sections.label: Icon Only
sections.description: Buttons can have icons without labels.

sections.label: Badges
sections.description: Buttons have built-in badge support with `badge` and `badgeSeverity` properties.

sections.label: Tooltip
sections.description: Tooltip shown on hover the button. It can be configured using prop `tooltip` and `tooltip-pos` for the position.

sections.label: Loading
sections.description: Busy state is controlled with the `loading` property.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { Button } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const isLoading = ref(false)

const toggleLoading = () => {
  isLoading.value = !isLoading.value
  if (isLoading.value) {
    setTimeout(() => {
      isLoading.value = false
    }, 3000)
  }
}
</script>

<template>
  <Button
    :label="isLoading ? 'Loading...' : 'Start Process'"
    :loading="isLoading"
    @click="toggleLoading"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Raised
sections.description: Text buttons can be displayed elevated with the `raised` option.

sections.label: Text
sections.description: Text buttons can be displayed without background using the `text` property.

sections.label: Outlined
sections.description: Outlined buttons display a border without a background using the `outlined` property.

sections.label: Template
sections.description: Custom content inside a button is defined as children using the default slot.

sections.label: Screen Reader
sections.description: Button component renders a native button element that implicitly includes any passed prop. Text to describe the button is defined with the `aria-label` prop, if not present `label` prop is used as the value. If the button is icon only or custom templating is used, it is recommended to use `aria-label` so that screen readers would be able to read the element properly.

sections.label: Keyboard Support
sections.description:
| Key | Function |
|-----|----------|
| tab | Moves focus to the button. |
| enter | Activates the button. |
| space | Activates the button. |

name: inputbadge
title: InputBadge
description: InputBadge is input text that changes it value into Badge component on Enter key pressed.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic input badge that converts text to badges on Enter.

sections.label: Email
sections.description: Input badge configured for email validation.

sections.label: Validation
sections.description: Input badge with form validation and required field.

sections.label: Editable
sections.description: Control which badges can be edited or removed.

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: Complete form example with input badge fields.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputBadge } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown> }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}

const onCancel = () => {
  console.log('Form cancelled')
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :column-per-row="1"
    submit-btn-label="Save Tags"
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'cancel', 'clear']"
    :hide-stay-checkbox="true"
    @submit="onSubmit"
    @cancel="onCancel"
  >
    <template #fields="{ formValues }">
      <InputBadge
        label="Skills"
        field-name="skills"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :initial-value="['JavaScript', 'Vue.js']"
        placeholder="Enter your skills"
        field-info="Press Enter to add each skill"
        :validator-message="{
          empty: 'At least one skill is required'
        }"
      />

      <InputBadge
        :use-validator="true"
        :initial-value="['Non Editable Tag']"
        :editable-values="['Frontend', 'Backend']"
        :removable-values="['Frontend', 'Backend', 'Database']"
        label="Project Tags"
        field-name="projectTags"
        placeholder="Enter project tags"
        field-info="Optional tags for categorization"
        remove-button-variant="disabled"
      />

      <!-- Example of conditional rendering based on form values -->
      <InputBadge
        v-if="formValues.skills && (formValues.skills as string[]).includes('Vue.js')"
        label="Vue.js Libraries"
        field-name="vueLibraries"
        :use-validator="true"
        :initial-value="['Nuxt.js', 'Pinia']"
        placeholder="Enter Vue.js related libraries"
        field-info="Shown because Vue.js is in your skills"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

name: inputrangenumber
title: InputRangeNumber
description: Handle input range number.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic range number input with two-way data binding using v-model.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { InputRangeNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const value = ref<number[]>([])
</script>

<template>
  <InputRangeNumber
    v-model="value"
    label="Price Range"
    placeholder="Enter price range"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Placeholders
sections.description: Range input with custom placeholders for minimum and maximum fields.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { InputRangeNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const value = ref<number[]>([])
</script>

<template>
  <InputRangeNumber
    v-model="value"
    label="Age Range"
    min-placeholder="Minimum age"
    max-placeholder="Maximum age"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Validation
sections.description: Range number input with form validation and mandatory field requirements.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { InputRangeNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const value = ref<number[]>([])
</script>

<template>
  <InputRangeNumber
    v-model="value"
    label="Salary Range"
    min-placeholder="Minimum salary"
    max-placeholder="Maximum salary"
    :use-validator="true"
    :mandatory="true"
    min-field-name="minSalary"
    max-field-name="maxSalary"
    :validator-message="{
      empty: 'Salary range is required'
    }"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Mandatory
sections.description: Range input with mandatory validation and custom error messages.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { InputRangeNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const value = ref<number[]>([])
</script>

<template>
  <InputRangeNumber
    v-model="value"
    label="Price Range"
    min-placeholder="Min price"
    max-placeholder="Max price"
    :mandatory="true"
    :use-validator="true"
    min-field-name="minPrice"
    max-field-name="maxPrice"
    :validator-message="{ empty: 'Price range is required' }"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: Range input in disabled state prevents user interaction.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { InputRangeNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const value = ref<number[]>([100, 500])
</script>

<template>
  <InputRangeNumber
    v-model="value"
    label="Price Range (Disabled)"
    min-placeholder="Min price"
    max-placeholder="Max price"
    :disabled="true"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: Range input showing invalid state with error message. Validator message will only be shown if `use-validator` set to true.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { InputRangeNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const value = ref<number[]>([])
</script>

<template>
  <InputRangeNumber
    v-model="value"
    label="Budget Range"
    min-placeholder="Minimum budget"
    max-placeholder="Maximum budget"
    :invalid="true"
    use-validator
    validator-message="Budget range is required for this project"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: Complete form example with range number input and validation. Similar to [InputNumber](/components/inputnumber), InputRangeNumber integrates seamlessly with form validation.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputRangeNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown> }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"
    hide-stay-checkbox
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputRangeNumber
        label="Salary Range (USD)"
        min-placeholder="Minimum salary"
        max-placeholder="Maximum salary"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        min-field-name="minSalary"
        max-field-name="maxSalary"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Salary range is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

name: badge
title: Badge
description: Badge is a component for displaying a text with optional remove functionality.

sections.label: Import
sections.description:
```typescript
import { Badge } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import type { ... } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue/badge';
```

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Basic badge with text label and different severity levels.

sections.label: Severity
sections.description: Different severity levels for styling purposes.

sections.label: Removable
sections.description: Badge with remove functionality and different remove button states.

sections.label: Disabled States
sections.description: Different disabled states for badge and remove button.

sections.label: Format
sections.description: Text truncation formats for different usage contexts.

sections.label: Dynamic Severity
sections.description: Use getSeverity function to dynamically determine badge severity based on label.

sections.label: Tooltips
sections.description: Custom tooltips and automatic tooltips for truncated text.

sections.label: Editable
sections.description: For creating multiple badges from text input, see [InputBadge](/components/inputbadge) component.

name: badgegroup
title: BadgeGroup
description: BadgeGroup component for displaying multiple badges with optional limit and more dialog.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic badge group with multiple labels.

sections.label: With Limit
sections.description: Badge group with limited display and more button.

sections.label: Object Labels
sections.description: Badge group with object-based labels for custom severity.

sections.label: Custom More Text
sections.description: Badge group with custom more button text and severity.

sections.label: Dialog Content
sections.description: Badge group with custom dialog content slot.

name: checkbox
title: Checkbox
description: Checkbox is an extension to checkbox element with label and info tooltip.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic checkbox with label.

sections.label: Binary
sections.description: Binary checkbox allows selecting a boolean value instead of multiple values.

sections.label: Tri-State
Disabled
sections.description: Disabled state prevents user interaction.

sections.label: Readonly
sections.description: Readonly state prevents modification while keeping the value visible.

sections.label: Tooltip
sections.description: Checkbox with tooltip information displayed on hover.

sections.label: Custom Values
sections.description: Checkbox with custom true and false values instead of boolean.

sections.label: Within Table
sections.description: Special styling when used inside table headers.

name: toggleswitch
title: ToggleSwitch
description: ToggleSwitch is used to select a boolean value.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic toggle switch with label.

sections.label: Tri-State
Disabled
sections.description: Disabled state prevents user interaction.

sections.label: Invalid
sections.description: Invalid state shows validation error styling.

sections.label: Readonly
sections.description: Readonly state prevents modification while keeping the value visible.

sections.label: Tooltip
sections.description: Toggle switch with tooltip information displayed on hover.

sections.label: Custom Values
sections.description: Toggle switch with custom true and false values instead of boolean.

name: menu
title: Menu
description: Menu is a navigation / command component that supports dynamic and static positioning.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic menu with navigation items.

sections.label: Popup
sections.description: Menu displayed as a popup overlay triggered by a button.

sections.label: Nested
sections.description: Menu with nested submenu items and separators.

sections.label: Icons
sections.description: Menu items with icons from the [WangsIcons](/components/icon) collection.

sections.label: Router Integration
sections.description: Menu integrated with Vue Router for navigation.

sections.label: Custom Template
sections.description: Menu with custom item templates and slots.

name: tabmenu
title: TabMenu
description: TabMenu is a navigation component that displays items as tab headers. Example below uses nested routes with TabMenu.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic tab menu with navigation items.

sections.label: Types
Icons
sections.description: Tab menu items with icons from the [WangsIcons](/components/icon) collection.

sections.label: Router Integration
sections.description: TabMenu integrated with Vue Router for navigation between routes.

sections.label: Active Index
sections.description: Control the active tab programmatically using activeIndex.

sections.label: Trailing Line
sections.description: Control the trailing line display at the end of tab menu.

name: dialog
title: Dialog
description: Dialog is a container to display content in an overlay window.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic dialog with header, content, and footer.

sections.label: Modal
sections.description: Modal dialog that blocks background interaction.

sections.label: Position
sections.description: Dialog can be positioned at different locations on the screen.

sections.label: Maximizable
sections.description: Dialog with maximize/minimize functionality.

sections.label: Draggable
sections.description: Dialog that can be dragged around the screen.

sections.label: Responsive
sections.description: Dialog with responsive breakpoints for different screen sizes.

sections.label: Custom Template
sections.description: Dialog with custom header, content, and footer templates using slots.

name: dropdown
title: Dropdown
description: Dropdown also known as Select, is used to choose an item from a collection of options.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic usage of dropdown with simple options.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Dropdown } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValue = ref()
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4']
</script>

<template>
  <Dropdown
    v-model="selectedValue"
    label="Select Option"
    :options="options"
    placeholder="Choose an option"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Object Options
sections.description: Dropdown with object options using `optionLabel` and `optionValue` properties.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Dropdown } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValue = ref()
const options = [
  { name: 'New York', code: 'NY' },
  { name: 'Rome', code: 'RM' },
  { name: 'London', code: 'LDN' },
  { name: 'Istanbul', code: 'IST' },
  { name: 'Paris', code: 'PRS' }
]
</script>

<template>
  <Dropdown
    v-model="selectedValue"
    label="Select City"
    :options="options"
    option-label="name"
    option-value="code"
    placeholder="Choose a city"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Badge Value
sections.description: Display selected value as a badge using `valueType` property.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Dropdown } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import type { BadgeProps } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue/badge'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValue = ref<BadgeProps['severity']>('success')
const options = [
  { label: 'Success', value: 'success' },
  { label: 'Info', value: 'info' },
  { label: 'Warning', value: 'warning' },
  { label: 'Danger', value: 'danger' }
]
</script>

<template>
  <Dropdown
    v-model="selectedValue"
    label="Select Status"
    :options="options"
    option-label="label"
    option-value="value"
    value-type="badge"
    :badge-value-props="{ severity: selectedValue }"
    placeholder="Choose status"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Loading
sections.description: Dropdown in loading state.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { Dropdown } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const selectedValue = ref()
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4']
</script>

<template>
  <Dropdown
    v-model="selectedValue"
    label="Select Option"
    :options="options"
    :loading="true"
    placeholder="Loading options..."
  />
</template>

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: Dropdown in disabled state.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Dropdown } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValue = ref('Option 2')
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4']
</script>

<template>
  <Dropdown
    v-model="selectedValue"
    label="Select Option"
    :options="options"
    :disabled="true"
    placeholder="Choose an option"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Filter
sections.description: Dropdown with search functionality enabled.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Dropdown } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValue = ref()
const options = [
  'Australia', 'Brazil', 'China', 'Egypt', 'France',
  'Germany', 'India', 'Japan', 'Spain', 'United States'
]
</script>

<template>
  <Dropdown
    v-model="selectedValue"
    label="Select Country"
    :options="options"
    :filter="true"
    filter-placeholder="Search countries..."
    placeholder="Choose a country"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Custom Placeholder
sections.description: Dropdown with custom placeholder text.

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: Dropdown integrated with form validation.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, Dropdown } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const options = ['Manager', 'Developer', 'Designer', 'Analyst']

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown> }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"
    hide-stay-checkbox
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <Dropdown
        label="Job Role"
        field-name="jobRole"
        :options="options"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Job role is required' }"
        placeholder="Select your role"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Custom Templates
sections.description: Dropdown with custom value and option templates using slots.

name: icon
title: Icon
description: Display icon with svg backgrounds from the WangsIcons collection.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Icons are displayed using the `icon` property with any value from the `WangsIcons` type.

sections.label: Severity
sections.description: Icons can be styled with different severities using the `severity` property.

sections.label: Tooltip
sections.description: Icons can display helpful information on hover using the `info` property.

sections.label: Icon Gallery
sections.description: Browse all available icons in the WangsIcons collection.

name: multiselect
title: MultiSelect
description: MultiSelect also known as Select, is used to choose an item from a collection of options.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic usage of multiselect with simple options.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValues = ref([])
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4', 'Option 5']
</script>

<template>
  <MultiSelect
    v-model="selectedValues"
    label="Select Options"
    :options="options"
    placeholder="Choose options"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Object Options
sections.description: MultiSelect with object options using `optionLabel` and `optionValue` properties.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValues = ref([])
const options = [
  { name: 'New York', code: 'NY' },
  { name: 'Rome', code: 'RM' },
  { name: 'London', code: 'LDN' },
  { name: 'Istanbul', code: 'IST' },
  { name: 'Paris', code: 'PRS' },
  { name: 'Tokyo', code: 'TKY' }
]
</script>

<template>
  <MultiSelect
    v-model="selectedValues"
    label="Select Cities"
    :options="options"
    option-label="name"
    option-value="code"
    placeholder="Choose cities"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Display Modes
sections.description: MultiSelect supports different display modes for selected items.

sections.label: Max Selected Labels
sections.description: Control how many selected items to show before displaying a summary.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValues = ref(['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3'])
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4', 'Option 5', 'Option 6', 'Option 7']
</script>

<template>
  <MultiSelect
    v-model="selectedValues"
    label="Select Options"
    :options="options"
    :max-selected-labels="2"
    selected-items-label="items selected"
    placeholder="Choose options"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Loading
sections.description: MultiSelect in loading state.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValues = ref([])
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4']
</script>

<template>
  <MultiSelect
    v-model="selectedValues"
    label="Select Options"
    :options="options"
    :loading="true"
    placeholder="Loading options..."
  />
</template>

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: MultiSelect in disabled state.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValues = ref(['Option 1', 'Option 3'])
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4']
</script>

<template>
  <MultiSelect
    v-model="selectedValues"
    label="Select Options"
    :options="options"
    :disabled="true"
    placeholder="Choose options"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Filter
sections.description: MultiSelect with search functionality enabled.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValues = ref([])
const options = [
  'Australia', 'Brazil', 'China', 'Egypt', 'France',
  'Germany', 'India', 'Japan', 'Spain', 'United States'
]
</script>

<template>
  <MultiSelect
    v-model="selectedValues"
    label="Select Countries"
    :options="options"
    :filter="true"
    filter-placeholder="Search countries..."
    placeholder="Choose countries"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Hide Header Checkbox
sections.description: MultiSelect without select all functionality.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
import { ref } from 'vue'

const selectedValues = ref([])
const options = ['Option 1', 'Option 2', 'Option 3', 'Option 4', 'Option 5']
</script>

<template>
  <MultiSelect
    v-model="selectedValues"
    label="Select Options"
    :options="options"
    :hide-header-checkbox="true"
    placeholder="Choose options"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: MultiSelect integrated with form validation.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, MultiSelect } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const options = ['JavaScript', 'TypeScript', 'Python', 'Java', 'C#', 'Go']

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown> }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"
    hide-stay-checkbox
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <MultiSelect
        label="Programming Languages"
        field-name="languages"
        :options="options"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'At least one language is required' }"
        placeholder="Select languages"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: InputPassword integrated within a Form component with validation.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputPassword } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown> }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)

<template>

    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"

</template>

name: dialogform
title: DialogForm
description: DialogForm is combination of Form and Dialog. Handles validation on submit using vee-validate. You need to install vee-validate while using this component.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: The basic usage of DialogForm with a simple text input field.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { DialogForm, InputText, Button } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const visible = ref(false)

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Button
    label="Open Dialog"
    @click="visible = true"
  />
  <DialogForm
    v-model:visible="visible"
    header="Basic Dialog Form"
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Name"
        field-name="name"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="false"
      />
    </template>
  </DialogForm>
</template>

sections.label: Stay After Submit
sections.description: Demonstrates the stay after submit functionality with showStayCheckbox enabled.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { DialogForm, InputText, Button, InputEmail } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const visible = ref(false)

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
  console.log('Stay after submit:', payload.stayAfterSubmit)
  visible.value = payload.stayAfterSubmit
}
</script>

<template>
  <Button
    label="Open Dialog"
    @click="visible = true"
  />
  <DialogForm
    v-model:visible="visible"
    header="Stay After Submit Dialog"
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"
    :show-stay-checkbox="true"
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Name"
        field-name="name"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Name is required' }"
      />
      <InputEmail
        label="Email"
        field-name="email"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Email is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </DialogForm>
</template>

sections.label: Reset After Submit
sections.description: Demonstrates the reset after submit functionality. Compare how forms behave with resetAfterSubmit enabled (default) vs disabled.

sections.label: Size
Severity
Validation
sections.description: Demonstrates form validation with a mandatory field.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { DialogForm, InputText, Button } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const visible = ref(false)

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Button
    label="Open Dialog"
    @click="visible = true"
  />
  <DialogForm
    v-model:visible="visible"
    header="Validation Dialog"
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Name"
        field-name="name"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :validator-message="{ empty: 'Name is required' }"
      />
    </template>
  </DialogForm>
</template>

sections.label: Custom Header
sections.description: Custom header using the header slot.

sections.label: Custom Buttons
sections.description: Custom buttons using actionButtons slot.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { DialogForm, InputText, Button } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const visible = ref(false)
const form = useTemplateRef<DialogForm>('dialogForm')

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown>, stayAfterSubmit: boolean }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}

const clearFields = () => {
  form.value?.clearField()
}
</script>

<template>
  <Button
    label="Open Dialog"
    @click="visible = true"
  />
  <DialogForm
    ref="dialogForm"
    v-model:visible="visible"
    header="Custom Buttons Dialog"
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputText
        label="Name"
        field-name="name"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="false"
      />
    </template>
    <template #actionButtons="{ submit }">
      <Button
        label="Clear"
        severity="secondary"
        @click="clearFields"
      />
      <Button
        label="Custom Save"
        class="mr-2"
        @click="submit"
      />
    </template>
  </DialogForm>
</template>

sections.label: Aside Right Slot
sections.description: Demonstrates the aside-right slot for adding content to the right side of the dialog, such as previews or additional information.

name: inputtext
title: InputText
description: InputText renders a text field to enter data.

sections.label: Import
sections.description:
```typescript
import { InputText } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
```

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Basic text input with label.

sections.label: Placeholder
sections.description: The default placeholder is taken from the label. You can customize it with the `placeholder` property.

sections.label: Character Restrictions
sections.description: Control allowed characters with regex patterns or special character settings.

sections.label: Max Length Prevention
sections.description: Prevent input when maximum length is reached.

sections.label: Validation on Blur
sections.description: Validate input on blur event instead of on input.

sections.label: Availability Check
sections.description: Async validation to check value availability.

sections.label: Existing Values
sections.description: Validate against existing values list.

sections.label: Validation States
sections.description: Different validation states and custom messages.

sections.label: Disabled State
sections.description: Disabled input state.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { InputText } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const disabledInput = ref('Disabled input')
</script>

<template>
  <InputText
    v-model="disabledInput"
    label="Disabled Input"
    placeholder="You cannot edit this"
    :disabled="true"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Slots
sections.description: Use addon slots to add icons, buttons, or text before and after the input field.

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: Complete form example with multiple text inputs and all features.

name: textarea
title: Textarea
description: Textarea is a multi-line text input element. Textarea is designed for longer text content with features like character counting and automatic height adjustment

sections.label: Import
sections.description:
```typescript
import { Textarea } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
```

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Basic textarea with label and placeholder.

sections.label: Size
sections.description: Control textarea dimensions with rows and cols properties.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { Textarea } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const customValue = ref('')
</script>

<template>
  <Textarea
    v-model="customValue"
    label="Custom Textarea"
    placeholder="6 rows with 50 cols"
    :rows="3"
    :cols="50"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Auto Resize
sections.description: Textarea that automatically adjusts height based on content.

sections.label: Character Limit
sections.description: Character counting and input prevention at maximum length.

sections.label: Disabled State
sections.description: Disabled textarea for read-only content display.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Textarea } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
</script>

<template>
  <Textarea
    label="Disabled"
    :disabled="true"
    :auto-resize="true"
    :rows="3"
    placeholder="Disabled textarea"
    field-info="This textarea is disabled"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Validation
sections.description: Textarea with built-in form validation that automatically handles empty input validation and character limit enforcement.

sections.label: Invalid State
sections.description: Manually control the invalid state with custom error messages for specialized validation scenarios not covered by standard validation rules.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { Textarea } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const invalidValue = ref('This content has an error')
</script>

<template>
  <Textarea
    v-model="invalidValue"
    :invalid="true"
    :rows="3"
    :use-validator="true"
    label="Invalid Content"
    placeholder="This shows an error"
    validator-message="This content contains inappropriate language"
  />
</template>

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: Complete form example demonstrating textarea in a form context.

name: inputnumber
title: InputNumber
description: Handle input number with form validation.

sections.label: Import
Basic
sections.description: Basic number input with two-way data binding using v-model.

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: Complete form example with number inputs and validation.
sections.example:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { Form, InputNumber } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'

const onSubmit = (payload: { formValues: Record<string, unknown> }) => {
  console.log('Form submitted:', payload.formValues)
}
</script>

<template>
  <Form
    :buttons-template="['submit', 'clear']"
    @submit="onSubmit"
  >
    <template #fields>
      <InputNumber
        label="Quantity"
        field-name="quantity"
        :use-validator="true"
        :mandatory="true"
        :min="1"
        :max="999"
        :show-buttons="true"
        :validator-message="{
          empty: 'Quantity is required'
        }"
      />
    </template>
  </Form>
</template>

sections.label: Min Max
sections.description: Number input with minimum and maximum value constraints.

sections.label: Buttons
sections.description: Number input with increment/decrement buttons.

sections.label: Prefix Suffix
sections.description: Number input with custom prefix and suffix text.

sections.label: Fraction Digits
sections.description: Number input with minimum and maximum fraction digits control.

sections.label: Grouping
sections.description: Number input with grouping separators (thousands separators).

sections.label: Locale
sections.description: Localization information such as grouping and decimal symbols are defined with the locale property which defaults to the user locale.

sections.label: Currency
sections.description: Number input configured for currency formatting with locale support.

sections.label: Disabled
sections.description: Number input in disabled state.

Validation with Custom State

name: inputurl
title: InputURL
description: Handle input url with form validation.

sections.label: Import
sections.description:
```typescript
import { InputURL } from '@fewangsit/wangsvue'
```

InputURL is a specialized wrapper around [InputText](/components/inputtext) that provides URL-specific validation and formatting. It inherits all the features and props from InputText while automatically setting the validation type to 'url' and providing URL-specific defaults like protocol validation.

sections.label: Basic
sections.description: Basic URL input with automatic URL validation.

sections.label: Protocol
sections.description: URL input with protocol validation that can be enabled or disabled.

sections.label: Validation
sections.description: URL input with form validation and custom error messages.

sections.label: Slots
sections.description: Use addon slots to add URL-specific icons, open links, or test API endpoints.

sections.label: Form Integration
sections.description: Complete form example demonstrating URL inputs in a form context.
